text.0: wno are these radiant men in serried rank rudras young heroes borne by noble steeds.
text.1: verily no one knoweth whence they sprang they and they only know each others birth.
text.2: they strew each other with their blasts these hawks they strove together roaring like the wind.
text.3: a sage was he who knew these mysteries what in her udder mighty pṛśni bore.
text.4: ever victorious through the maruts be this band of heroes nursing manly strength.
text.5: most bright in splendour flectest on their way closeknit to glory strong with varied power.
text.6: yea mighty is your power and firm your strength so potent with the maruts be the band.
text.7: bright is your spirit wrathful are your minds your bold troops minstrel is like one inspired.
text.8: ever avert your blazing shaft from us and let not your displeasure reach us here.
text.9: your dear names conquering maruts we invoke calling aloud till we are satisfied.
text.10: wellarmed impetuous in their haste they deck themselves their forms with oblations to you the pure ornaments made of gold.
text.11: pure maruts pure yourselves are your oblations to you the pure pure sacrifice i offer.
text.12: by law they came to truth the laws observers bright by their birth and pure and sanctifying.
text.13: your rings o maruts rest upon your shoulders and chains of gold are twined upon your bosoms.
text.14: gleaming with drops of rain like lightningflashes after your wont ye whirl about your weapons.
text.15: wide in the depth of air spread forth your glories far most adorable ye bear your titles.
text.16: maruts accept this thousandfold allotment of household sacrifice and household treasure.
text.17: if maruts ye regard the praise recited here at this mighty singer invocation.
text.18: vouchsafe us quickly wealth with noble heroes wealth which no man uho hateth us may injure.
text.19: the maruts fleet as coursers while they deck them like youths spectators of a festal meeting.
text.20: linger like beauteous colts about the dwelling like frisking calves these who pour down the water.
text.21: so may the maruts help us and be gracious bringing free room to lovely earth and heaven.
text.22: far be your bolt that slayeth men and cattle ye vasus turn yourselves to us with blessings.
text.23: the priest when seated loudly calls you maruts praising in song your universal bounty.
text.24: he bulls who hath so much in his possession free from duplicity with hymns invokes you.
text.25: these maruts bring the swift man to a standstill and strength with mightier strength they break and humble.
text.26: these guard the singer from the man who hates him and lay their sore displeasure on the wicked.
text.27: these maruts rouse even the poor and needy the vasus love him as an active champion.
text.28: drive to a distance o ye bulls the darkness give us full store of children and descendants.
text.29: never o maruts may we lose your bounty nor carborne lords be hitidmost when ye deal it.
text.30: give us a share in that delightful treasure the genuine wealth that bulls is your possession.
text.31: what time the men in fury rush together for running streams for pastures and for houses.
text.32: then o ye maruts ye who spring from rudra be our protectors in the strife with foemen.
text.33: full many a deed ye did for our forefathers worthy of lauds which even of old they sang you.
text.34: lle strong man with the maruts wins in battle the charger with the maruts gains the booty.
text.35: ours o ye maruts be the vigorous hero the lord divine of men the strong sustainer.
text.36: with whom to fair lands we may cross the waters and dwell in our own home with you beside us.
text.37: may indra mitra varuṇa and agni waters and plants and trees accept our praises.
text.38: may we find shelter in the maruts bosom preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
